content.description: Climb the low-angled face to the first bolt (up high).  Climb through three steep sections and take rests in between.  Good warm-up.  None of the guides I've seen have a name or FA information for this route.
content.protection: 8 bolts to Metolius rap hanger anchor.
content.location: On the far left of the Orangutan Wall, there is a large cave at two-thirds height.  This route climbs the line to the left of the black streak and to the right of the cave.

content.description: Ascends the left margin of the water streak to good anchors. Steep but big holds.
content.location: If you are below Monkey Duodenum and Full Moon Monkey there is a water streak to your left. Turbofly is the route that ascends the left margin of the black streak. Most of the route is in the black stone.

content.description: Fun route, good for the mental game as the crux is between the first and second bolt, which are close together.  After that the movement is fun, but not hard, however the bolt distances felt like they got farther and farther apart. Maybe 15 ft between last bolt and anchor/chains. Just a tad Pumpy!
content.location: 3 left of Superfly, or going left to right on the wall, it is the first route to the right of the routes containing PINK painted bolts.  Stand on the hill above the stream gully to belay

content.description: Ascends the black water streak. Excellent well protected route. This route now has its own set of anchors (formerly shared anchors with the route Full Moon Monkey to its left).
content.protection: Approx 7 Bolts will get you up this route. Chains at the anchor (no mussy's like its neighbors to the left and right)
content.location: Route furthest on right hand side of wall; follow the obvious waterstreak.

content.description: Long and sustained route and my favorite at Maple Canyon for moderates!  Don't miss this route but tie knots in end of 60m rope because it will use every inch of it!!  Great Route
content.protection: 10 Bolts will get you to the fixed anchors for your rapple; careful!
content.location: In the middle of Orangutan Wall and about 20 feet left of Full Moon Monkey.

content.description: Crimpy sustained climbing, the hardest route on the Orangutan Wall.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on the lower section of the Orangutan Wall up the flat, light colored section of rock, between Angel's Share and Creampuff's anchors.

content.description: Very fun route with nine bolts that shares anchors with next route on right.  Excellent climbing on quality rock make this a route not to be missed in Maple; was originally bolted at 3:30 AM on a full moon night!
content.protection: Nine bolts will get you to the fixed anchors for rappel with one rope.
content.location: Start on a rib between two obvious holes in the wall; Excellent Climbing on this route!

content.description: Good climb, nice bolt spacing for all climbers.  Early morning sun.   Slightly harder than Superfly only in that there are less options between the Tons of holds available to the climber, causing you to perhaps make a move.  Well spaced bolts. Crux may be right before or after the last bolt.

Long route with lots of jugs, good sidepulls and a couple of pockets. There is a slight bulge near the top which is easily navigated via the huge jugs.

Well bolted and cleaned, very fun.
content.protection: 12 bolts with 1 rap hanger and 1 chain at the top
content.location: This is now the right most route on the wall, about 10 feet right of Primate Grooming Procedures.

content.description: Shoot up the easy-angled face to the first pink bolt (up high) on the left side of the black streak.  Follow 8 bolts up a contiuously vertical face and angle right to the chains.  Nice, long warm-up.  None of the guides I've seen have a name or FA information for this route.
content.protection: 8 pink bolts to a 2 bolt anchor (shared with route to the right).
content.location: On the left side, where the streambed touches the Orangutan Wall, climb the left side of the black streak.  Metolius rap anchors.

content.description: Scramble up the low-angled face to the first pink bolt(up high) on the right side of the black streak.  Climb the vertical face to a convex rest ledge with a big undercling.  Pull out of the rest area and pump it out until you reach the top.  None of the guides I've seen have a name or FA information for this route.
content.protection: 9 pink bolts to a 2 bolt anchor (shared with route to the left).
content.location: On the left side, where the streambed touches the Orangutan Wall, climb the right side of the black streak.  Metolius rap anchors.

content.description:
A fairly long climb by Maple standards,

The Angel's Share

starts out low angled and progressively steepens to vertical below the first bolt. The climbing is on vertical to slightly overhanging rock the rest of the way. Positive holds most of the way, along with some pockets, sidepulls, and pinches. Depending on the season you may disturb some of the resident wasps.
content.location:
The Angel's Share

climbs light colored rock between two black streaks. The first two bolts and hangers are reddish brown in color.
